abstract: A Russian Internet investment group is plugging $200 million into the company for about a 2 percent stake. By that arithmetic, Facebook would be worth $10 billion.
snippet: A Russian Internet investment group is plugging $200 million into the company for about a 2 percent stake. By that arithmetic, Facebook would be worth $10 billion.
lead_paragraph: Holy cow, Facebook is worth $10 billion? That may be how the social networking Web site would like the world to interpret its latest capital infusion. But don’t be fooled. While that may represent a target valuation for Facebook, the actual worth, today, of Mark Zuckerberg’s dorm room creation may be much lower.

byline.original: By ROB COX and PIERRE BRIANÇON
